concept.title: Requesting Data Notification Tutorial
concept.shortdesc: Explains how to use the kernel trace tool API to request data notification.

section.title: Purpose
section.p: Trace data is written to kernel side chunks. The kernel trace tool API can request notification that data has been written and requires further processing.

section.title: Intended audience
section.p: This document is intended for application developers writing a trace tool using the kernel trace tool component.

section.title: Required background
section.p: The trace filters defined in EUser. The kernel trace tool component in general.

section.title: Introduction
section.p: Requesting data notification is a short task which is performed in combination with related tasks as explained in Kernel Trace Tool Tutorial.

section.title: Using the API
section.p: These are the function calls required to

li.p: Call the RequestData() function of the RBTrace object. This function has two arguments:
a TRequestStatus object which takes the value KErrNone when data becomes available, and
a TInt specifying the minimum number of bytes to return.
The TRequestStatus object is intended for use in the test statement of a loop in which the function call is embedded.
